content:
I am new to this chat, and new to FHIR. I just wanted something in the main windowe, but then found a specific discussion on V2 to FHIR.
I'm trying to understand FHIR in the context of having a tone of HL7 v2 experience. Is anybody willing to chat with me or answer a few one-off questions about how a FHIR implementation might look, in comparison to accomplishing the same thing with V2? Thank you.

There may be a couple of options to join calls and ask your questions. v2-to-FHIR refers to projects that convert v2 messages to FHIR resources. If that's the scope you're interested in, you're welcome to join our regular calls (we meet this Thursday at 11AM Eastern. If you're more interested in lab related workflows (suggest by the thread title), then the OO on FHIR calls on Tuesday afternoons at 2PM Eastern might be your best bet. All of these calls (including Zoom links if you are logged into your HL7 account) are listed on the HL7 Conference Call Center at https://www.hl7.org/concalls/Default.aspx. Note that next week is HL7's Working Group Meeting, so many of the regularly scheduled calls won't be happen (and a lot of the calls aren't scheduled yet for the weeks after that (but they should continue as normal).

This page may help in your understanding: https://hl7.org/fhir/comparison-v2.html.
If you have specific questions I'm sure many people here would be happy to answer. There are also some excellent Intro to FHIR videos on youtube that cover some of the history of HL7 standards and how/why FHIR came about which will add some context.

If you want lab not just FHIR, then the OO lab calls on Fridays at 1 PM ET.
All mentioned calls use the OO call Coordinates, which are:
